channel.title: Islam Naasani Blog
channel.description: My personal Blog, I write about problems I've faced or new things I've learned.

item.title: Git Conventional Commits Made Easy with AI
item.description: Stick to following Conventional Commits by leveraging AI. This guide shows how to setup in VS Code and how to share the configuration across the team.
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: The Front-End Workshop That Didn't Go as Planned: My First Teaching Experience
item.description: Last month, I was invited to do a one-week workshop about front-end development at Aleppo University. In this article, I'll be sharing my experiences and thoughts from standing in front of a classroom as the instructor for the first time.
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: Your Modules Should be Deep, Generics Will Help You with That.
item.description: The best modules are deep ones, a lot of functionality hidden behind a simple interface. We will see how Generics can help us design such interfaces.
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: Filling the Gaps in Next.js App Router: What the Docs Overlook in Scalable Apps
item.description: How to manage state in server components in a type-safe way? What are your options if you want an OpenAPI Spec for your route handlers API? How to handle errors in server actions? I'll try to answer those questions in this article.
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: What Makes a Good Dashboard
item.description: Some tips that I believe can improve the UX for a dashboard application (or any app).
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: Getting the Most Out of Vscode
item.description: A few vscode features and how I use them on a daily basis.
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: Understanding How let Declaration Works in for Loop
item.description: You may have come across two code snippets comparing let and var declarations in for loop and the weird behavior of var... but is it really weird?
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: Implementing an Iterable Linked List in JavaScript
item.description: Did you know that you can create your own iterable objects (can be used with spread operator (...)) in JavaScript?
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani

item.title: Blog Posts You May Want to Read
item.description: A list of blog posts that I've read and found them to be useful.
item.dc:creator: Islam Naasani
